Welcome to Sky Resources! 
 
 If you are playing with Void Island Control, type /island create (optional type) for your own island. 
 Depending on what you start with, choose one of the islands to get started. 
 <link,Sand_Island,minecraft:sand:1,sandIsland> 
 <link,Snow_Island,minecraft:snow:0,snowIsland> 
 <link,Wood_Island,minecraft:planks:5,woodIsland> 
 <link,Grass_Island,minecraft:grass:0,grassIsland> 
 If you don't have JEI, I don't know how you're going to get through modded MC. I'm not giving info on crafting if it's in JEI at all in this guide.
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage1.sandIsl:
To get started on the sand island, you're going to need some <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:alchemy_item_component:0> . 
 Recommended to keep 1 cactus at all times if you want to progress. Using a <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:cactus_cutting_knife:0> , make some <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:cactus_fruit:0> , which has high saturation for regenerating. 
 A <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:red_sandstone_infusion_stone:0> or <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:sandstone_infusion_stone:0> is needed for <link,Life_Infusion,skyresourcesclassic:alchemical_infusion_stone:0,lifeInfusion> . 
 Using <link,Life_Infusion,skyresourcesclassic:alchemical_infusion_stone:0,lifeInfusion> , you can duplicate <recipe,,minecraft:cactus:0> . You can also use it on a <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:cactus_fruit_needle:0> to get a <recipe,,minecraft:sapling:4> . Also, use <link,Life_Infusion,skyresourcesclassic:alchemical_infusion_stone:0,lifeInfusion> to get <recipe,,minecraft:dirt:1> . If you find that you are running out of life too quickly, try spamming the <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:cactus_needle:0> plucking.
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage1.lifeInf:
In order to do life infusion, you need a few things to do it. 
 First, you need an infusion stone. There are 3 by default. 
 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:red_sandstone_infusion_stone:0> <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:sandstone_infusion_stone:0> <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:alchemical_infusion_stone:0> 
 Next, look in JEI for a recipe and put the items shown in the off-hand slot (the slot with the shield icon) into your off-hand slot. 
 Hold the infusion stone in your main hand and right click the block shown to get your result. 
 
 The infusion stone also works like Bone Meal, but damages yourself. 
 Life infusion can be automated with the <link,Life_Infuser,skyresourcesclassic:life_infuser:0,life_infuser> .
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage1.snowIsl:
To get started on the snow island, you're going to need some <recipe,,minecraft:snowball:0> and a <recipe,,minecraft:pumpkin:0> . 
 In order to get <recipe,,minecraft:snowball:0> , shift right-click the snow to get them, and don't use the second pumpkin as it is needed for later. 
 Make a snow golem and make sure it doesn't fall off the edge or die. Get more snow from the snow golem. 
 Next, you need to make a <link,Mini_Freezer,skyresourcesclassic:mini_freezer:0,miniFreezer> , which is used to make <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:heavy_snowball:0> . 
 The <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:heavy_snowball:0> and <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:heavy_explosive_snowball:0> can be used as projectile weapons as they deal a lot of damage. 
 Make a mob farm using the snow, or <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:heavy_snow:0> blocks for rotten flesh and bones. 
 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:fleshy_snow_nugget:0> can be made for food. 
 The mob farm will be used to make <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:heavy_snow2:0> , which can then be froze into <recipe,,minecraft:dirt:1> . 
 Another block of <recipe,,minecraft:dirt:1> is needed for a <recipe,,minecraft:sapling:1> .
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage1.miniFre: The <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:mini_freezer:0> is the first tier of freezers. The <link,Iron_Freezer,skyresourcesclassic:iron_freezer:0,ironFreezer> is the next tier. \n This freezer runs at 0.25x the speed of the <link,Iron_Freezer,skyresourcesclassic:iron_freezer:0,iron_freezer> . 1x is the normal speed shown in JEI. This freezer can also only freeze 1 stack of items at a time.
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage1.woodIsl: To get started on the wood island, you're going to need a <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:survivalist_fishing_rod:0> . \n Keep fishing until you get a block of <recipe,,minecraft:dirt:0> and a <recipe,,minecraft:sapling:0> (any sapling).
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage1.grassIs: The grass island skips over stage 1, so start with stage 2. \n This is due to having dirt and a tree on this island.
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage2.combust:
There are 4 types by default. The <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:wooden_combustion_heater:0> , <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:iron_combustion_heater:0> ,  <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:steel_combustion_heater:0> and <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:dm_combustion_heater:0> are part of the combustion multiblock structures. 
 The multiblock can be set up as shown here <image,shown_here,skyresourcesclassic:wooden_combustion_heater:0,combustion> 
 
 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:wooden_combustion_heater:0> 
 Maximum temperature of 100 C. 
 Fuels with relatively high burn times will not work. 
 
 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:iron_combustion_heater:0> 
 Maximum temperature of 1538 C. 
 Fuels with very high burn times will not work. 
 
 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:steel_combustion_heater:0> 
 Maximum temperature of 2750 C. 
 Runs off of FE and requires 800 FE/tick to heat up. Right-click with empty hand to see FE and heat. 
 
 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:dm_combustion_heater:0> 
 Maximum temperature of 6040 C. 
 Runs off of FE and requires 1200 FE/tick to heat up. Right-click with empty hand to see FE and heat. 
 
 
 The crafting process is as follows: 
 Drop a set of items into the center for crafting (NOTE: Make sure the ratio is correct). 
 Provide the heater with fuel to get a high enough temperature. 
 Give the heater a redstone signal (Ex: Button). 
 If there was an explosion, it worked! 
 
 
 There are automation upgrades including the <recipe,,minecraft:dropper:0> , <link,Quick_Dropper,skyresourcesclassic:quick_dropper:0,quick_dropper> , and <link,Combustion_Collector,skyresourcesclassic:combustion_collector:0,combustionCollector> .
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage2.waterEx:
The <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:water_extractor:0> is used for storing, extracting, placing, and inserting water. It can hold 4000mB of water. 
 To extract water from blocks, hold right-click for a little bit and let go. It can also pick up water source blocks. 
 To place water, you must have 1000mB of water and shift-right click to place it in the world. 
 To insert water into blocks, you must have the required water amount and right click the block. 
 All recipes for extracting and inserting are in JEI. Check the uses of the <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:water_extractor:0> . 
 The water extractor can be automated with the <link,Aqueous_Concentrator_and_Deconcentrator,skyresourcesclassic:aqueous_concentrator:0,aqueous> .
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage2.dirtFur: Use the <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:dirt_furnace:0> to get access to torches, and other smeltable items without a Cobblestone generator.
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage2.lavaBla:
The <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:blaze_powder_block:0> is used for creating lava. 
 To get lava, place the blaze powder block above a <link,heat_source,minecraft:torch:0,heatSources> as <image,shown_here,skyresourcesclassic:blaze_powder_block:0,lava> . 
 Note that you will want to be able to setup your first lava for a Cobblestone generator. 
 
 Lava can also be obtained using a <link,Crucible,skyresourcesclassic:Crucible:0,crucible> .
Lava can be obtained by throwing a <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:blaze_powder_block:0> into a <link,Crucible,skyresourcesclassic:Crucible:0,crucible> .
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage2.heatSou:
Heat Sources are used for heating many functional blocks. 
 Heat Sources go under these blocks: 
 <link,Crucible,skyresourcesclassic:crucible:0,crucible>  
 <link,Alchemical_Condensers,skyresourcesclassic:stone_condenser:0,alchemicalCondenser> 
 <link,Blaze_Powder_Block,skyresourcesclassic:blaze_powder_block:0,lavaBlaze> 
 Better heat sources make the blocks mentioned earlier run faster. 
 
 List of heat sources are shown in JEI. 
 Look for uses of common heat sources like the <recipe,,minecraft:torch:0> and <recipe,,minecraft:obsidian:0> .
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage1.heatPro:
Heat Providers are blocks that act as great <link,heat_sources,minecraft:torch:0,heatSources> , but require fuel or power to run. 
 There are 4 types: 
 
 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:wooden_heater:0> 
 Uses Furnace fuels. 
 Fuels last as long as they do in a Furnace 
 Has a heat level of 5 
 
 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:iron_heater:0> 
 Uses Furnace fuels. 
 Fuels half the amount they'd last in a Furnace 
 Has a heat level of 10 
 
 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:steel_heater:0> 
 Uses RF. 
 Requires 120RF/t 
 Has a heat level of 30 
 
 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:dm_heater:0> 
 Uses RF 
 Uses 480RF/t 
 Has a heat level of 120
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage2.rockGri: The rock grinder allows for the player to break Cobblestone down into Gravel, and Gravel into Sand, and more. \n There are 3 by default, which are the <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:stone_grinder:0> , <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:iron_grinder:0> , and <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:diamond_grinder:0> . \n Rock grinding can be automated with the <link,Rock_Crusher,skyresourcesclassic:rock_crusher:0,rockCrusher> .
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage2.metalCr:
To get started in metal creation you're going to need to get <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:iron_crystal:0> , the first available shard, through <link,combustion,skyresourcesclassic:wooden_combustion_heater:0,combustionHeater> . 
 The rest of the process is done using the following blocks : 
 <link,Crucible,skyresourcesclassic:crucible:0,crucible> 
 <link,Fluid_Dropper,skyresourcesclassic:fluid_dropper:0,fluidDropper> 
 <link,Stone_Alchemical_Condenser,skyresourcesclassic:stone_condenser:0,alchemicalCondenser> 
 <link,Stone_Crystallizer,skyresourcesclassic:stone_crystallizer:0,crystallizer> . 
 
 For an early game setup, a <link,Crucible,skyresourcesclassic:crucible:0,crucible> , 2 <link,Fluid_Droppers,skyresourcesclassic:fluid_dropper:0,fluidDropper> , and either a <link,Crystallizer,skyresourcesclassic:stone_crystallizer:0,crystallizer> or <link,Alchemical_Condenser,skyresourcesclassic:stone_condenser:0,alchemicalCondenser> . 
 <image,View_Condenser_Setup,skyresourcesclassic:stone_condenser:0,ingotSetup> 
 <image,View_Crystallizer_Setup,skyresourcesclassic:stone_crystallizer:0,crystalSetup> 
 
 NOTE: Some shards use a different process instead of using the <link,Alchemical_Condenser,skyresourcesclassic:stone_condenser:0,alchemicalCondenser> . Check the uses of the shards.
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage2.crucibl:
The <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:crucible:0> is used for creating crystal fluid from crystal shards. 
 This requires a <link,heat_source,minecraft:torch:0,heatSources> underneath to function. 
 Drop the item in and it will turn into the fluid. 
 Crystal fluid can be condensed using the <link,Alchemical_Condenser,skyresourcesclassic:stone_condenser:0,alchemicalCondenser> , or crystallized into more crystal shards using a <link,Crystallizer,skyresourcesclassic:stone_crystallizer:0,crystallizer> . 
 It can be automated with the <link,Crucible_Inserter,skyresourcesclassic:crucible_inserter:0,crucibleInserter> .
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage2.fluidDr: The <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:fluid_dropper:0> will pull fluids from tanks next to it and place the source below it when it has 1 bucket. \n This is useful for automating the output of the <link,Crucible,skyresourcesclassic:crucible:0,crucible> .
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage2.alchemi:
There are 4 types by default, the <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:stone_condenser:0> , <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:iron_condenser:0> ,  <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:steel_condenser:0> and <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:dm_condenser:0> . 
 Condenses crystal fluids above the block and requires a <link,heat_source,minecraft:torch:0,heatSources> under it. 
 Turn off with a redstone signal! 
 
 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:stone_condenser:0> 
 CANNOT condense molten crystal fluid. 
 Runs at 1x speed. 
 
 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:iron_condenser:0> 
 CAN condense molten crystal fluid. 
 Runs at 2x speed. 
 
 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:steel_condenser:0> 
 CAN condense molten crystal fluid. 
 Runs at 3x speed. 
 
 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:dm_condenser:0> 
 CAN condense molten crystal fluid. 
 Runs at 4x speed.
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage2.crystal:
There are 4 types by default, the <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:stone_crystallizer:0> , <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:iron_crystallizer:0> ,  <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:steel_crystallizer:0> and <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:dm_crystallizer:0> . 
 Crystallizes crystal fluids above the block and drops the shards under it either in the world, or a valid inventory. 
 Turn off with a redstone signal! 
 Crystal fluid may disappear depending on the efficiency of the crystallizer and the rarity of the fluid. 
 NOTE: The lower the rarity of the metal and the higher tier of crystallizer, the more shards you will get, and eventually it will give infinite shards from one fluid source. 
 
 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:stone_crystallizer:0> 
 CANNOT crystallize molten crystal fluid. 
 Runs at 0.5x speed. 
 Efficiency value of 1. 
 
 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:iron_crystallizer:0> 
 CAN crystallize molten crystal fluid. 
 Runs at 1x speed. 
 Efficiency value of 1.5. 
 
 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:steel_crystallizer:0> 
 CAN crystallize molten crystal fluid. 
 Runs at 2.5x speed. 
 Efficiency value of 2. 
 
 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:dm_crystallizer:0> 
 CAN crystallize molten crystal fluid. 
 Runs at 4x speed. 
 Efficiency value of 3.
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage2.crucibl: The <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:crucible_inserter:0> is used for automatically inserting items into the <link,crucible,skyresourcesclassic:crucible:0,crucible> . \n Items are "piped" in using hoppers, conduits, etc.
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage2.combust:
The <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:combustion_collector:0> is used for automatically collecting items during <link,combustion,skyresourcesclassic:wooden_combustion_heater:0,combustionHeater> . 
 Items are sent to the <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:combustion_collector:0> after each crafting process, allowing the crafting process to be uninterrupted by the results being "stuck." 
 
 This CANNOT be used with the <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:wooden_combustion_heater:0> .
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage2.quickDr:
The <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:quick_dropper:0> is used for dropping a full stack of items at a time with no redstone pulse. 
 Stops when given a redstone signal. 
 
 This CANNOT be used with the <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:wooden_combustion_heater:0> .
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage2.crushed:
Dusts for ores are obtained through this process. 
 First, use the <link,rock_grinder,skyresourcesclassic:stone_grinder:0,rockGrinder> on <recipe,,minecraft:stone:0> to get <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:stone_crushed:0> and  <recipe,,minecraft:netherrack:0> to get <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:netherrack_crushed:0> . 
 Next, right-click the crushed rock on to a <recipe,,minecraft:cauldron:0> filled with water to get dusts. This will not work if the dust for the ore does not exist in ore dictionary. Dusts have a chance to drop based on their rarity. 
 The <recipe,,minecraft:cauldron:0> can be automated with the <link,Rock_Cleaner,skyresourcesclassic:rock_cleaner:0,rockCleaner> .
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage2.gemProd:
Gems like Emeralds, Diamonds, etc are obtained through this process. 
 First, use the <link,rock_grinder,skyresourcesclassic:stone_grinder:0,rockGrinder> on stone to get dirty gems like the <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:dirty_emerald:0> . These have a low chance to drop. 
 Next, right-click the dirty gems on to a <recipe,,minecraft:cauldron:0> filled with water to get the clean, usable gems. This will not work if the clean gems do not exist in ore dictionary. 
 The <recipe,,minecraft:cauldron:0> can be automated with the <link,Rock_Cleaner,skyresourcesclassic:rock_cleaner:0,rockCleaner> .
guide.skyresources.stage2.wildlifeAttrac: The <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:wildlife_attractor:0> will attract random animals into the world on top of this block at a random rate of about 1 animal every 30 seconds. \n Requires 40 RF/tick, 20mB of water/tick, and <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:plant_matter:0> which lasts for 6 seconds. \n Stops when given a redstone signal.
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage3.alchemi:
There are 4 alchemical items used for advanced crafting currently. 
 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:diamond_alchemical:0> 
 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:dust_alchemical:0> 
 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:gold_ingot_alchemical:0> 
 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:gold_needle_alchemical:0>
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage3.ironFre: The <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:iron_freezer:0> is the second tier of freezers. \n To setup the <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:iron_freezer:0> , place 2 of these blocks vertically to form the multiblock, as <image,shown_here,skyresourcesclassic:iron_freezer:0,ironFreezer> . \n This freezer runs at 1x speed. This freezer can freeze 3 stacks of items at a time.
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage3.rockCru: The <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:rock_crusher:0> automates <link,rock_grinding,skyresourcesclassic:stone_grinder:0,rockGrinder> . \n Requires 80 RF/tick. \n Needs a type of <link,Rock_grinder,skyresourcesclassic:stone_grinder:0,rockGrinder> to run.
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage3.rockCle: The <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:rock_cleaner:0> automates the <recipe,,minecraft:cauldron:0> . \n Requires 80 RF/tick. \n Needs 250 mB to run.
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage3.aqueous: The <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:aqueous_concentrator:0> and <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:aqueous_deconcentrator:0> automate the <link,Water_Extractor,skyresourcesclassic:water_extractor:0,waterExtractor> inserting and extracting respectively. \n Requires 80 RF/tick.
guide.skyresourcesclassic.misc.nether.te: All materials normally found in the nether are now obtainable in other ways. \n Nether ores are obtained through the <link,metal_creation,skyresourcesclassic:stone_condenser:0,metalCreation> process. \n Nether mobs can be found either through naturally spawning them or using the <link,Dark_Matter_Warper,skyresourcesclassic:dark_matter_warper:0,dmWarper> .
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage3.dmWarpe: The <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:dark_matter_warper:0> is used for getting rare mobs.  \n It consumes <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:dark_matter:0> to run (needed every 6 min) and affects a 8x8x8 cube around the <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:dark_matter_warper:0> . \n It turns skeletons into wither skeletons, squid into blazes, spiders into cave spiders, and hurts players and animals.
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage3.end.tex:
The end portal requires a multiblock structure. The following are needed: 
 1 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:end_portal_core:0> 
 4 <recipe,,minecraft:diamond_block:0> 
 4 <recipe,,minecraft:gold_block:0> 
 16 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:dark_matter_block:0> 
 8 <recipe,,minecraft:end_bricks:0> 
 4 <recipe,,minecraft:glowstone:0> 
 
 <image,Multiblock_Setup,skyresourcesclassic:end_portal_core:0,end> 
 To use the portal, stand on the core, and give the <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:end_portal_core:0> at least 16 <recipe,,minecraft:ender_eye:0> and a redstone pulse (button). 
 
 *gl A ilfsiesrvh waenrsp si itaecv nda reyv edsroanug ehwn eht urturscte is valdi! *nl
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage3.healthG: The <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:item_health_gem:0> is used to boost maximum health and stores health for use in the <link,Life_Infuser,skyresourcesclassic:life_infuser:0,lifeInfuser> . \n Shift right-click to infuse 2 health (or 1 heart). You will gain 1 health for every 50 health infused (by default).
guide.skyresourcesclassic.stage3.lifeInf:
The <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:life_infuser:0> is used to automate <link,Life_Infusion,skyresourcesclassic:alchemical_infusion_stone:0,lifeInfusion> . 
 The life infuser requires a multiblock structure. The following are needed: 
 1 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:life_infuser:0> 
 8 <recipe,,minecraft:log:0> (any type of wood) 
 8 <recipe,,minecraft:leaves:0> (any type of leaves) 
 1 <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:dark_matter_block:0> 
 
 <image,Multiblock_Setup,skyresourcesclassic:life_infuser:0,infuser> 
 To use it, put in the health gem on the right, infusion stone in the middle, off-hand item on the left, place the block getting infused below the core, and give the core the a redstone pulse, through the <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:dark_matter_block:0> works best. 
 Make sure the <link,Health_Gem,skyresourcesclassic:item_health_gem:0,healthGem> has enough health to infuse.
guide.skyresourcesclassic.misc.armorplus: Sky Resources provides for ways to get the <recipe,,armorplus:lava_crystal:0> .
guide.skyresourcesclassic.misc.enderio.t: Sky Resources provides for ways to get the <recipe,,enderio:itemBrokenSpawner:0> .
Sky Resources provides a way to get <recipe,,forestry:bee_princess_ge:0> and <recipe,,forestry:bee_drone_ge:0> . 
 This is done by making a <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:bee_attractor:0> . 
 The <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:bee_attractor:0> requires RF and <recipe,,forestry:fluid.seed.oil:0> . 
 Every 10 seconds, there is a chance for a <recipe,,forestry:bee_princess_ge:0> or <recipe,,forestry:bee_drone_ge:0> to be in the <recipe,,skyresourcesclassic:bee_attractor:0> . 
 The species depends on the biome, just like hives. 
 Note that a <recipe,,forestry:bee_princess_ge:0> is rarer than a <recipe,,forestry:bee_drone_ge:0> .
Sky Resources provides for ways to get Integrated Dynamics items. \n \n <recipe,,integrateddynamics:menril_berries:0> and <recipe,,integrateddynamics:menril_sapling:0> are obtainable.
guide.skyresourcesclassic.misc.extremere: Sky Resources provides for ways to get Extreme Reactors items. \n \n <recipe,,bigreactors:dustmetals:0> is obtainable.
guide.skyresourcesclassic.misc.tinkers.t: Sky Resources provides for ways to get Tinker's Construct slimy items. \n \n All variants of the <recipe,,tconstruct:edible:1> , <recipe,,tconstruct:slime_sapling:0> , and the <recipe,,tconstruct:slime_dirt:0> are obtainable.
guide.skyresourcesclassic.misc.techrebor: Sky Resources provides for ways to get basic TechReborn items. \n \n <recipe,,techreborn:part:31> is obtainable as well as the <recipe,,techreborn:rubber_sapling:0> .
guide.skyresourcesclassic.misc.actadd.te: Sky Resources provides for ways to get basic Actually Additions items. \n \n <recipe,,actuallyadditions:item_misc:5> is obtainable. The <recipe,,actuallyadditions:item_rice_seed:0> , <recipe,,actuallyadditions:item_canola_seed:0> , <recipe,,actuallyadditions:item_coffee_seed:0> , <recipe,,actuallyadditions:item_flax_seed:0> are dropped from breaking tall grass.
guide.skyresourcesclassic.misc.ae2.title: Applied Energistics 2 Support
guide.skyresourcesclassic.misc.ae2.text: Sky Resources provides for ways to get basic AE2 items. \n \n <recipe,,appliedenergistics2:material:0> , <recipe,,appliedenergistics2:material:1> , <recipe,,appliedenergistics2:sky_stone_block> are obtainable as well as the 4 inscriber presses.
